perturbation.original_text: The cooperation fee under this Agreement will be RMB200 million, of which RMB160 million will be channel cooperation fee and RMB40 million will be promotion fee for the Cooperation Channel. The cooperation fee will be payable in four installments as follows   (a) Within 15 business days after the date hereof, Party B will pay RMB50 million to Party A.   (b) Within 15 business days after the end of the first cooperation period, Party B will pay another RMB50 million to Party A.   (c) Within 15 business days after the end of the second cooperation period, Party B will pay another RMB50 million to Party A.   (d) Within 15 business days after the end of the third cooperation period, Party B will pay the remaining RMB50 million to Party A.
perturbation.changed_text: The cooperation fee under this Agreement will be RMB200 million, of which RMB160 million will be channel cooperation fee and RMB40 million will be promotion fee for the Cooperation Channel. The cooperation fee will be payable in four installments as follows   (a) Within 30 business days after the date hereof, Party B will pay RMB50 million to Party A.   (b) Within 10 business days after the end of the first cooperation period, Party B will pay another RMB50 million to Party A.   (c) Within 20 business days after the end of the second cooperation period, Party B will pay another RMB50 million to Party A.   (d) Within 25 business days after the end of the third cooperation period, Party B will pay the remaining RMB50 million to Party A.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the payment deadlines. Initially, the payment for the first installment is due within 15 business days, but it changes to 30 business days, 10 business days for the second installment, 20 business days for the third installment and 25 business days for the last installment. This in-text contradiction creates uncertainty and ambiguity in enforcing the payment schedule. Thus, it leads to disputes over payment dates.

perturbation.original_text: 5.10 Party C will be severally and jointly liable for any and all obligations of Party B under this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.10 Party C will be severally liable for 50% of the obligations of Party B under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the liability of Party C. The original text states that Party C is severally and jointly liable for all obligations of Party B, meaning Party C can be held responsible for all or any part of Party B's obligations. The modified text states that Party C is severally liable for 50% of the obligations, limiting their liability. This contradiction creates uncertainty in enforcement, as it is unclear whether Party C is responsible for all obligations or only half.

perturbation.original_text: 10.4 Post-Termination Matters   (a) Unless otherwise provided under Section 10.1 of this Agreement, upon early termination of this Agreement, Party A will return to Party B the channel cooperation fee paid by Party B net part of the payment for the obligations which have been performed under this Agreement. If this Agreement is early terminated for any fault of Party B, Party B may not claim for any reason repayment of any channel cooperation fee paid to Party A. Termination of this Agreement will affect any settlement or payment obligation outstanding under this Agreement, or any obligation or right accrued prior to such termination.
perturbation.changed_text: 10.4 Post-Termination Matters   (a) Unless otherwise provided under Section 10.1 of this Agreement, upon early termination of this Agreement, Party A will return to Party B 50% of the channel cooperation fee paid by Party B regardless of the payment for the obligations which have been performed under this Agreement. If this Agreement is early terminated for any fault of Party B, Party B may claim for 50% repayment of channel cooperation fee paid to Party A. Termination of this Agreement will not affect any settlement or payment obligation outstanding under this Agreement, or any obligation or right accrued prior to such termination.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction regarding the reimbursement of the channel cooperation fee upon early termination. The original text says that if the agreement is terminated early due to the fault of Party B, then Party B will not receive any repayment of the channel cooperation fee. The modified text states that if the agreement is terminated early due to the fault of Party B, then Party B may claim for 50% repayment of channel cooperation fee paid to Party A. This contradiction creates uncertainty in enforcement, as it is unclear whether Party B will or will not be reimbursed for the channel cooperation fee should early termination occur.
